stepTitle: Refer to a figure of baseball diamond, which has sides of $$90$$ ft.
stepBody: A batter hits a ball toward second base at $$80$$ $$\frac{ft}{sec}$$ and runs toward first base at a rate of $$30$$ $$\frac{ft}{sec}$$. At what rate does the distance between the ball and the batter change when the runner has covered one-third of the distance to first base? (Hint: Recall the law of cosines.)##figure1.gif##
